metadata.title: CVE-2017-17081 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
The gmc_mmx function in libavcodec/x86/mpegvideodsp.c in FFmpeg 2.3 and 3.4 does not properly validate widths and heights, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (integer signedness error and out-of-array read) via a crafted MPEG file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-17081` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

ffmpeg - 7:3.4.1-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.1-1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:3.4.1-1
libavcodec58 - 7:3.4.1-1
libavdevice58 - 7:3.4.1-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.1-1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:3.4.1-1
libavfilter7 - 7:3.4.1-1
libavformat-extra - 7:3.4.1-1
libavformat-extra58 - 7:3.4.1-1
libavformat58 - 7:3.4.1-1
libavutil56 - 7:3.4.1-1
libpostproc55 - 7:3.4.1-1
libswresample3 - 7:3.4.1-1
libswscale5 - 7:3.4.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1').
ffmpeg package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.4.1-1').
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
